**Tables and Figures**

**Figure 1** Sex ratio over time in Juvenile Seychelles warblers. The dotted and dashed lines represent equal sex ratio and 95% confidence limits from simulated sex ratio data based on temporal variation in sample size, respectively. 

**Figure 2** Parental telomere length and offspring sex ratio in the Seychelles warbler. **A** Maternal and peternal telomere length are not related to one another. **B-D** Offspring sex ratio in relation to maternal (**B**), paternal (**C**) and mean parental telomere length (**D**). Individual points represent individual male (top) and female (bottom) offspring. Lines and shaded areas represent fitted values and 95% confidence limits from a logistic regression.

**Figure 3** Parental telomere length and offspring condition and survival in the Seychelles warbler.  **A** Offspring telomere length in relation to maternal telomere length, **B** paternal telomere length, and **C** mean parental telomere length. **D** Offspring survival to adulthood in relation to telomere length. Lines and shaded areas represent estimates and 95% confidence limits from linear regressions (**A-C**) and logistic regression (**D**). Blue = males, red = Females.


```{r Figure 1}
Fig1 <- ggplot(ddFig1,aes(x = Year, y = sr)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_line(aes(y = upperCI),lty = 2) +
  geom_line(aes(y = lowerCI),lty = 2) +
  theme_lgs() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 60,hjust=1)) +
  ylim(c(0,1)) +
  geom_abline(aes(intercept = 0.5,slope = 0),lty=3,col=grey(0.5)) +
  ylab('Proportion male offspring')

pdf('Figures/Figure 1.pdf',
    paper = 'a4',
    width = 3.5,
    height =3.5)
Fig1
dev.off()


```

```{r Figure2}

Fig2A <- ggplot(FL,aes(x = LdadTLKB,y = LmumTLKB)) +
  geom_point(alpha=0.2) +
  xlab('Paternal TL (kb)') +
  ylab('Maternal TL (kb)') +
  theme_lgs(addlegend = T) +
  annotate(geom = 'text',x = 1,y = 12,label = 'A')

Fig2B <- ggplot(FL,aes(x = LmumTLKB,y = SexEstimate)) +
  geom_point(alpha=0.2) +
  stat_smooth(method = 'glm',family = 'binomial',se=T) +
  xlab('Maternal TL (kb)') +
  ylab('Proportion male offspring') +
  theme_lgs(addlegend = T) +
  annotate(geom = 'text',x = 1,y = 1,label = 'B')

Fig2C <- ggplot(FL,aes(x = LdadTLKB,y = SexEstimate)) +
  geom_point(alpha=0.2) +
  stat_smooth(method = 'glm',family = 'binomial',se=T) +
  xlab('Paternal TL (kb)') +
  ylab('Proportion male offspring') +
  theme_lgs(addlegend = T) +
  annotate(geom = 'text',x = 1,y = 1,label = 'C')
Fig2D <- ggplot(FL,aes(x = parTL,y = SexEstimate)) +
  geom_point(alpha=0.2) +
  stat_smooth(method = 'glm',family = 'binomial',se=T) +
  xlab('Mean parental TL (kb)') +
  ylab('Proportion male offspring') +
  theme_lgs(addlegend = T) +
  annotate(geom = 'text',x = 1,y = 1,label = 'D')


pdf('Figures/Figure 2.pdf',
    paper = 'a4',
    width = 7,
    height =7)
multiplot(Fig2A,Fig2B,Fig2C,Fig2D,layout=matrix(c(1,2,3,4),2,2,byrow=T))
dev.off()

```
